meanings.sent1: She tends to overinform her friends about every little detail of her day.
meanings.sent2: The teacher didn't mean to overinform the students, but she wanted to make sure they understood the lesson.
meanings.sent3: The tour guide decided to overinform the group with facts about every single tree they passed.
meanings.sent4: His emails always overinform me with unnecessary details, making it hard to find the important information.
meanings.sent5: The documentary overinformed viewers with so many facts that it became overwhelming to keep track of everything.

meanings.definition: To give more information than necessary.
meanings.sent1: Please don't overinform the audience with too many statistics during your presentation.
meanings.sent2: I tend to overinform my friends when I get excited about a new topic.
meanings.sent3: The detective decided to overinform the suspect with details of the crime to see if they would slip up.
meanings.sent4: The website overinformed users with pop-up ads, making it difficult to navigate.
meanings.sent5: The book overinformed readers with background information that wasn't relevant to the main plot.
